Truth! I shall speak you if I am in habit of listening to you,

Rattle windows in their frames,
Leave your fingerprints on mirrors
I've carefully avoided.

Perhaps if I made space for you at breakfast,
Set a place at my table each morning,
I might grow accustomed to your face,
Find rhythm in your persistent cadence.

Truth! I shall speak you when I've learned
To hear you without flinching,
